page.description: The !$ operator determines whether the character expression on the left of the operator is not contained anywhere within the character expression on the right.
page.syntax: Result as L = Find_String as C !$ Search_String as C

argument.name: Find_String
argument.description: The character string that you are looking for.

return.name: Result
return.description: Returns .t. if *[xb:Search_String]* is not found in *[xb:Find_String]*, otherwise .f.

page.discussion: Operations involving the !$ operator return a logical result (i.e., TRUE or FALSE). The string comparison is not case sensitive. See also [Character Search Functions].

section.title: Example:
section.example:
dim Company as C Company = "The Computer Store"
? "Computer" !$ Company = .F.
? "computer" !$ Company = .F.
? "Alpha" !$ Company = .T.
